snippet: A strongly worded statement by Zeid Ra’ad al-Hussein is the latest twist in a diplomatic struggle to conduct a credible investigation of events in the country’s brutal civil war.
abstract: Zeid Ra’ad Al Hussein, United Nations human rights chief, sharply rebukes Sri Lankan government for what he says are efforts to obstruct an investigation of events in 2009, at end of Sri Lanka's brutal civil war, that may have constituted war crimes.
lead_paragraph: A strongly worded statement by Zeid Ra’ad al-Hussein is the latest twist in a diplomatic struggle to conduct a credible investigation of events in the country’s brutal civil war.

headline.main: U.N. Rights Chief Says Sri Lanka Is Obstructing War Crimes Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Sri Lanka: Government Rebuked Over Stalled Inquiry

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
